page.title: 15Population, N. Lopham
page.content: We did a mini-survey of school- children's families, to see how many were N. Lopham 'natives'. Asking where mothers came from, we found that the families were fairly equally divided - about 1/3 coming from N. Lopham, 1/3 from elsewhere in E. Anglia, 1/3 from outside E. Anglia. However, asking where fathers came from, only one was a North Lopham native. About 1/4 came from outside East Anglia and the vast majority came from elsewhere in East Anglia. Aparently our mothers like to stay in their home village to bring up their own children, but the fathers are more mobile. When it came to grandparents of school-children, fewer than 1/5 had 'native' g'parents on the father's side, compared with well over 1/3 on the mother's side, so this shows the same trend.
